meanings.definition: To make or become rough or harsh in texture or tone.
meanings.sent1: The sandpaper will coarsen the surface of the wood.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the constant rubbing will coarsen the fabric.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally used the wrong detergent, and now my favorite sweater feels coarsen.
meanings.sent4: The anger in his voice seemed to coarsen the atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The relentless wind and rain coarsen the once smooth stones into jagged edges.

meanings.definition: To make or become less refined or cultured.
meanings.sent1: The reality show aims to coarsen the tastes of its viewers.
meanings.sent2: Living in the city may coarsen some of the manners you grew up with.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a joke only served to coarsen the conversation further.
meanings.sent4: The constant exposure to violence seemed to coarsen his sensibilities over time.
meanings.sent5: The fast food culture can coarsen our appreciation for home-cooked meals.
